com.java.model.player

Class PlayerStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.java.model.Observable
      • com.java.model.player.PlayerStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AggresiveMode, BenevolentMode, CheaterMode, HumanMode, RandomMode

    public abstract class PlayerStrategy
extends Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class models the player strategy, it holds the id, the name, and the order to play for the round robing.
    Version:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Arnav Bhardwaj, Karan Dhingra, Ghalia Elkerdi, Sahil Singh Sodhi, Cristian Rodriguez
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getPotentialAttackScenarios

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getPotentialAttackScenarios()
        All of the potential attack scenarios for current player.
        Returns:
        the comprehensive list with all source and target countries.

      • getActualMaxAllowedDiceCountForAction

        public int getActualMaxAllowedDiceCountForAction(java.lang.String action,
                                                 java.lang.String countryInScopeForAction,
                                                 int maxDiceCountAllowedForAction)
        Helper method to get max allowable dice count given specific context: action and country army count.
        Parameters:
        action: - either attack/defense.
        countryInScopeForAction: - either the source country to attack from / the target country to be attacked.
        maxDiceCountAllowedForAction: - a default max based on Risk game rules.
        Returns:
        selectedDiceCount: a valid number of dice to roll based on action and army counts.

      • fight

        public java.lang.Boolean fight(AttackPhaseState attackPhase)
        Main fight method which encompasses the dynamic interactions of rolling and comparing dice This handles the army count updates as well as conqueror id's if need be.
        Parameters:
        attackPhase - Attack Phase object
        Returns:
        true if attacker conquers the target country

      • checkIfPlayerHasConqueredTheWorld

        public boolean checkIfPlayerHasConqueredTheWorld()
        Helper method to check if the player conquered the whole world.
        Returns:
        true if they conquered the entire world

      • getPotentialFortificationScenarios

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getPotentialFortificationScenarios()
        Helper method to build a comprehensive map of all the possible fortification paths (for both immediate and extended neighbors) It has all the necessary checks and validation to ensure the path includes only countries owned by the given current player in the turn. Moreover, ensures that candidates suggested as "source countries" to move armies from satisfy the minimal requirements of army presence on the ground.
        Returns:
        Hashmap of all potential fortification scenarios for player.

      • placeArmy

        public abstract void placeArmy(java.lang.Integer reinforcementArmy)
        This method depends on each strategy, in this case how the player is going to put the army after the calculation of the armies during reinforcement.
        Parameters:
        reinforcementArmy - number of army to place

      • executeAttack

        public abstract void executeAttack()
        Method to begin attack.

      • getCountryToAttackFrom

        public abstract java.lang.String getCountryToAttackFrom(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> attackScenarios)
        Depends on the strategy of each player, wheter the input comes from the human or bot.
        Parameters:
        attackScenarios - array of possible attack countries to attack from.
        Returns:
        the country choosed by the player whether is a human or bot.

      • getEnemyCountryToAttack

        public abstract java.lang.String getEnemyCountryToAttack(java.lang.String selectedSourceCountry,
                                                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> attackScenarios)
        Depends on the strategy of each player, it receives the selected country to attack from and the method accepts a valid country to attack to.
        Parameters:
        selectedSourceCountry - country to attack from.
        attackScenarios - every attack scenario.
        Returns:
        the selected country to attack to, whether a human or bot.

      • getDesiredDiceCountFromPlayer

        public abstract java.lang.Integer getDesiredDiceCountFromPlayer(java.lang.String player,
                                                                java.lang.String country,
                                                                java.lang.String action)
        Gets the number of allowed number of dice base on the action ("attack" or "defend")
        Parameters:
        player - who is going to roll the dice.
        country - the country where the player is attacking or defending.
        action - ("attack" or "defend")
        Returns:
        the number of dices to roll.

      • getNumberofArmiesAttackerWantsToMove

        public abstract java.lang.Integer getNumberofArmiesAttackerWantsToMove(java.lang.String selectedSourceCountry)
        After conquering a country the player can decide how many armies are going to be moved to the conquered country.
        Parameters:
        selectedSourceCountry - selected country.
        Returns:
        the number of armies to be moved.
